system.description: The true wonder seeker, these mages are the philosophers of the world, always seeking out more knowledge and more wisdom. The Storm Mage is a logician, a tactical intellectual who prefers to neutralize opponents rather than destroy them. Often cold, the Storm Mage is also tumultuous and crafty. If you are playing a Storm Mage, be curious, hungry for information, always in the clouds, tricky and clever, eluding rather than confronting.

overview.base: You may rotate between @L[Category:Storm element spells]{storm} rotator @L[Category:Spells]{spells} during a @L[Core:Short Rest]{short rest} instead of a @L[Core:Long Rest]{long rest}.
overview.proficient: You are @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in @L[Ability:Storm Rotators]{Storm Rotators}. (This does not make you @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in the @L[Category:Spells]{spells} themselves.)

overview.base: When you @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack} with @L[Ability:Lightning Ray]{Lightning Ray} or @L[Ability:Ice Ball]{Ice Ball}, you may target an additional creature or the same creature twice. Any costs you pay must be paid twice and be the same for both @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attacks} These incur @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack penalties} as though they were two separate @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attacks}.
overview.fluent: You may instead choose up to 1 + @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} additional or repeated targets.

overview.base: Add @L[Ability:Reflect Magic]{Reflect Magic} and @L[Ability:Teleport]{Teleport} to your list of possible @L[Category:Rotator spells]{rotator spells}.

In addition to the custom rotator spells you create, you can learn @L[Category:Rotator spells]{spells} created by others. When you come across a fully created spell using only words you are @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in, can make a DC 12 + OP @L[Core:INT]{INT} @L[Core:Feat Interaction]{feat save} to attempt to learn it. If you succeed, you can add it to your rotator spell list. If you fail, you are @L[Keyword:Incapable]{incapable} of attempting to learn that spell again. The @L[Core:GM]{GM} may modify the DC based on the spell's complexity, your knowledge of the spell, any special training you receive, if the spell's creator is there to assist you, or for any other factors they see fit. You may also attempt to learn words that you come across as long as they are of elements you are @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in. The @L[Core:GM]{GM} may adjust the DC for these as they see fit as well, but the default is DC 15 + OP @L[Core:Intelligence]{INT} @L[Core:Feat Interaction]{feat save}.
overview.proficient: You are @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in @L[Ability:Elder Sorcery Creation]{Elder Sorcery Creation}, @L[Ability:Celestial Elder Sorcery Words]{Celestial Elder Sorcery Words}, and @L[Ability:Storm Elder Sorcery Words]{Storm Elder Sorcery Words}.

results.save: You learn the spell or word.
results.fail: You are @L[Keyword:Incapable]{incapable} of attempting to learn that spell or word again.

overview.base:
Once per @L[Core:Short Rest]{short rest}, you may cast a @L[Category:Ritual delivery spells]{ritual} @L[Category:Storm element spells]{storm spell} in half the time it would normally take. Additionally, once per long rest, you may cast a @L[Category:Storm element spells]{storm spell} as though you were @L[Keyword:Adept]{adept} at it.

You also gain the @L[Ability:Bouncy Casting]{Bouncy} and @L[Ability:Illusive Casting]{Illusive} casting styles.
overview.proficient: You may now use the benefits from Storm Disciplines @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} times per @L[Core:Long Rest]{long rest}.
overview.fluent: You may now use the benefits from Storm Disciplines @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} times per @L[Core:Short Rest]{short rest}.

overview.base: Target @L[Category:Conjured spells]{spell} @L[Core:Fizzles]{fizzles}, as do any others cast simultaneously within range. Their casters take the spells' effects instead.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, the range of Reflect Magic increases by 15 feet.
system.trigger: A @L[Category:Conjured spells]{conjured spell} is used within range.

overview.base: Target takes the "on hit" effect of a @L[Category:Conjured spells]{conjured} @L[Category:Missile delivery spells]{missile spell} that you are @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{proficient} in. If the triggering hit was a critical hit, then the target takes the "on critical hit" effect instead.

system.trigger: You have just landed a hit with a @L[Category:Weapon delivery abilities]{weapon} or @L[Category:Bite delivery abilities]{bite} @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attack} on another creature and the effect has successfully applied.
system.limitation: Only usable with @L[Ability:Lightning Ray]{Lightning Ray} and @L[Ability:Ice Ball]{Ice Ball}.

overview.base:
You may choose a new target for the @L[Category:Spells]{spell}. All @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack rolls}, @L[Core:Feat Interaction]{feat saves}, and other dice rolls or effects are re-rolled or re-calculated as if the @L[Category:Spells]{spell} was cast on the new target. The range of the @L[Category:Spells]{spell} remains unchanged, but is calculated from the new target instead of from you.
Note: If the @L[Category:Spells]{spell} was @L[Core:Heightening]{heightened}, or you spent any other @L[Category:Cost spells]{costs} on the @L[Category:Spells]{spell}, those remain unchanged and do not need to be re-spent.

system.trigger: The target of a @L[Category:Spells]{spell} does not get affected by your @L[Category:Spells]{spell}.

overview.base: Target creature is moved to a location you have studied within your level in miles. You can study locations by performing this ritual on an area you are in over the course of a @L[Core:Long Rest]{long rest}. This location must be a static part of the environment, not a moving location like a wagon or ship. If the location substantially changes beyond recognition, your ritual will fail to transport creatures there. You can only have 2 location studied at a time.
overview.proficient: You may now have 2 × @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} locations studied and can teleport a distance of up to @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} × your level in miles.
overview.fluent: You may now have 2 × @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} locations studied and can teleport a distance of up to @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} × your level in miles.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, your maximum teleport distance increases by your level in miles.

overview.base: The triggering @L[Category:Spells]{spell} appears to be a different @L[Category:Abilities]{ability} of the same @L[Category:Delivery abilities]{delivery}. This is a @L[Keyword:Illusionary]{minor illusion}.

system.endCondition: You ar no longer casting the triggering @L[Category:Spells]{spell}.
